text:

text:
Following Trump's retreat from threatening Tehran

A few hours ago, Trump posted a warning saying " immediately evacuate Tehran," but after this post, he reiterated his stance on Iran's nuclear program in two separate messages on social media: "America First" policy means many important issues, including that Iran should not and cannot acquire nuclear weapons. Let's Make America Great Again!" He also told Tucker Carlson: "Please someone explain to Tucker Carlson that Iran should not and cannot have nuclear weapons." These messages seem to indicate internal pressures and opposition to his previous position, which was more warning-oriented, telling Iran to "immediately evacuate Tehran."
title: Trump's Shift on Iran Threats

text:
US Secretary of State Marco Rubio discussed issues related to the Israel-Iran conflict with his colleagues.

This was reported by the US State Department. In a phone conversation with UK Foreign Secretary David Lidington, Rubio addressed the ongoing Israel-Iran conflict. Secretary Rubio and Foreign Secretary Lidington confirmed their commitment toä¿æŒ close contact and to promote a diplomatic path that ensures Iran never develops nuclear weapons.

Marco Rubio also discussed the Israel-Iran conflict in a phone call with EU High Representative for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy and Vice-President of the European Commission, Kaja Kallas. During the call, the parties reaffirmed their commitment to maintain close contact with allies and partners.

Rubio also spoke on the phone with French Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian to discuss the developing situation in the Middle East. The parties agreed to continue close cooperation to promote a diplomatic path that guarantees Iran will not develop nuclear weapons.
title: US and Allies Discuss Middle East Nuclear Threat

text:
In 'I DATE,' the international community is called upon to curb Azerbaijan's threats against Syunik amid regional escalation.

"In the context of the Iran-Israel conflict, geopolitical instability has increased, creating an additional threat of Azerbaijani aggressive actions that threaten Armenia's sovereignty.

title: International Calls to Stop Azerbaijani Threats

text:
The Prosecutor General's Office of Armenia has filed 16 lawsuits with the Anti-Corruption Court demanding the compulsory termination of the right to develop land plots located in the city park zone of the community of Ijivan, Tavush Province, and the return of land plots to the community of Ijivan.

On June 12, 2025, the Anti-Corruption Court made decisions on three of the above lawsuits, fully satisfying the main claim of the Prosecutor General's Office.

The Court's rulings terminated development rights for three land plots with areas of 350.1 sq. m, 322.1 sq. m, and 360.1 sq. m.

text:
Hours ago, Trump issued a warning saying "Immediately evacuate Tehran," but after that, in two separate messages on social media, he reiterated his position on Iranâ€™s nuclear program and wrote:

"America First" policy means many important things, including that Iran should not and cannot obtain nuclear weapons. Letâ€™s make America great again!

He also told Tucker Carlson: "Please, someone tell Tucker Carlson that Iran should not and cannot have nuclear weapons."

These messages indicate internal pressure and opposition to this stance and a backtracking from his previous position where he had warned: "Immediately evacuate Tehran."
title: Trump's Retreat on Iran Nuclear Threat

text:
Former village head of Goravan, Ararat Province, Arsen Bazikyan, organized 33 fictitious land sale auctions in Goravan, registering ownership and lease rights for himself, family members, and relatives over 543 hectares of land in the same settlement.

On December 23, 2024, the prosecutor launched a public criminal prosecution against Arsen Bazikyan.
On May 30, 2025, the prosecutor also initiated criminal proceedings against Bazikyan's son for assisting the ex-village head in abuse of power (23 episodes).
On June 10, 2025, the prosecutor filed a separate criminal case against Bazikyan's son with a confirmed indictment and sent it to the Anti-Corruption Court.
title: Armenian Ex-Village Head Accused of Land Fraud

3- Mossad building and a lieutenancy information center of the Zionist regime (completely destroyed)

4- Nwatim base (partially destroyed)

5- Near the Ministry of War of the Zionist regime

Additional information is under review...

text:
The existential war of the Israeli regime against the Iranian nation and Baku's role: Iranian site "Ahmad Kazemi"

The illegal and comprehensive war of the Zionist regime... can be viewed from different perspectives. The phased goals of this war primarily aim to disable Iran's air defense and military capabilities, eliminate Iran's deterrent offensive power, destroy the country's strategic infrastructure, and ultimately dismember it through ethnic groups and mercenaries, leading to regime overthrow through Balkanization and Syrianization tactics.

The Zionist enemy has devised several plans to realize this sinister goal, one of which involves exploiting anti-Iranian capabilities created by the Baku government and associated ethnic mercenary networks.

In this regard, it can be explained:
- Tabriz has been subjected to more attacks compared to some other parts of the country, including nuclear regions. Hundreds of military personnel and civilians have been killed and injured in repeated attacks at about twenty points in Tabriz. Many of these attacks were carried out using drones and quadcopters, which, according to residents near border areas liberated during the Second Karabakh War, infiltrated Iran from those regions.
- The facility known as "AZAD Systems" is located on the outskirts of Baku. It was commissioned in 2011, two years after a joint agreement between Israel and Azerbaijan, and currently produces three types of attack drones. These drones played the biggest role in defeating the defense system in Tabriz, Ardabil, and Urmia, as well as martyring dozens of compatriots, including Azerbaijani women and children. The most detections of vehicles transporting enemy drones, quadcopters, and explosives occurred in Tabriz and Northwestern Iran, heavily influenced by Baku's ethnic espionage network.
- The intensity of attacks on Tabriz is directly linked to mercenary activities of Azerbaijanâ€™s ethnic spy network, established after independence. Today, this network also acts as a fifth column and foot soldiers for the Zionist enemy in weapons supply, with their hands stained with the blood of Iranians, including our dear Azerbaijani compatriots.
- The creation of an ethnic Baku network in Iran centered in Tabriz for Zionist regime mercenaries is a long-term process, funded by Baku through diaspora committees, the formation of parties, media, and systematic anti-Iranian literature publications in Baku. Baku's activity and the allocated budget for building this network increased several fold after 2006, peaking after the Second Karabakh War. Now, this ethnic network has the strongest support in the bloodshed caused by the Zionist regime in Tabriz and Northwestern Iran.
- Baku's government, which Netanyahu called the most crucial strategic ally of Tel Aviv among Islamic countries, was among the first to support anti-Iran actions and the Zionist regime's operations. In response to the initial round of anti-Iranian services and actions by the Aliev family from 2003 to 2020â€” including cooperation in the assassination of nuclear scientists, stealing nuclear documents, drone infiltrations, wiretapping, and numerous other major servicesâ€”Israel designed the 2020 war and also undertook ethnic cleansing of the region's indigenous Armenians to create a "second Israel" there.
- Aliev's government, which has taken around 10 million worthy citizens hostage in a quasi-hereditary form of governance, opposes the country's historic, religious, and national identity, and has become a regional base for Zionism.
title: Israeli Regime's War Against Iran and Baku's Role

text:
Participants attending the Gathering at the Supreme Council in Etchmiadzin visited the Tsitsernakaberd Memorial, Yereb-lur, and the tomb of Komitas

Gathered at the Supreme Council in Etchmiadzin for the Congregation Meeting, monks of Holy Etchmiadzin, serving in dioceses and church structures of Armenia and the diaspora, on June 16 visited the Tsitsernakaberd Memorial complex before the official start of the gathering, paying homage to the Holy Martyrs of the Armenian Genocide. After laying a wreath at the Memorial complex, the clergy also performed a memorial service for the Holy Martyrs of the Armenian Genocide.

Then the clergy went to the military pantheon Yereblur to pay tribute to the memory of brave soldiers who gave their lives for the homeland, and to pray for their soulsâ€™ repose and peace.

Participants of the Congregation Meeting also visited the Komitas Pantheon to pay respects to the great son of the Armenian people. The monks served a memorial service at Komitas's grave.
title: Armenian Clergy Visited War and Genocide Memorials

text:
One of the current hotspots of geopolitical tension around Iran has seen the US and Israel focus on completely neutralizing Iran's nuclear and missile capabilities.

To date, Israel has carried out conventional strikes on Iran, although it is clear that without US intelligence and military support, these actions would be impossible.

However, Israel has not yet been able to approach its goal: the main success was a temporary disruption of power at the Natanz nuclear facility. All other attempts have failed.

According to IAEA Director Rafael Grossi, Iran's nuclear centers are located under concrete layers up to 800 meters deep, and in these centers (Natanz, Fordow, Isfahan), Iran continues to operate modern centrifuges that provide uranium enrichment and technological breakthroughs. This has raised concerns in Israeli and American circles: experts believe Tehran already has the technical ability to produce nuclear weapons.

Destruction of this infrastructure is currently virtually impossible for Israel, as only a US anti-bunker bomb "GBU-57" could inflict damage on such deep and well-protected facilities. This, in turn, influences Washington's position, and Israel has to seek US intervention.

Amid recent political events, Donald Trump's behavior is particularly notable. Without waiting for the end of the G7 Summit, he returned to Washington and publicly called on Iran's leadership to begin negotiations immediately. With his recent statements and publications, Trump is effectively issuing an ultimatum to Iran, demanding that Iranâ€”through Araghchiâ€”immediately begin negotiations with the US through Whitcoff. This is a diplomatic pressure move, but Iran continues to stand firm.

If diplomatic pressure and ultimatums do not work, it is quite possible that the US will take military action to damage Iran's nuclear capabilities.
title: US and Israel Target Iran's Nuclear Capabilities

text:
India requested Armenia to help evacuate Indian students from Iran.

Armenia's foreign ministers discussed the possibility of evacuating Indian students from Iran through Armenia. Armenia has provided the necessary assistance, said the press secretary of the RA MFA, Ani Badalyan.
title: Armenia Assists in Evacuating Indian Students from Iran

text:
Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza:
â€”
Updated toll: 51 martyrs and over 200 injuries, including 20 in critical condition, have arrived at Nasser Medical Complex following a massacre committed by the occupation against citizens waiting for aid at the Al-Tahlia roundabout in Khan Younis governorate this morning.

Emergency, intensive care, and operating departments are extremely overcrowded due to the large number of casualties.

Medical teams are working with limited stocks of life-saving medicines and supplies.

The Ministry of Health renews its urgent appeal to all concerned parties to urgently reinforce emergency medical supplies.

Ministry of Health
17 June 2025
title: Gaza Medical Emergency Amidst Attacks

text:
Iran is not developing nuclear weapons: CNN

When Israel launched a series of strikes on Iran last week, it issued a number of high-profile statements about the country's nuclear program, claiming that Iran is rapidly approaching a point of no return in its pursuit of nuclear weapons, and that the strikes were necessary to prevent such an outcome.

However, assessments from American intelligence have reached a different conclusion: Iran is not actively developing nuclear weapons, and, according to four people familiar with the assessment, it will only be able to produce and deliver them to its target in three years.

Now, after several days of Israeli airstrikes, US intelligence officials believe that Israel has possibly set back Iran's nuclear program for a few months. Despite Israel causing significant damage to Iran's Natanz facility, where uranium enrichment centrifuges are located, the heavily fortified enrichment site in Fordo remains almost intact.

Military experts say Israel has no capability to damage Fordo without special US weapons and air support.
title: Iran Nuclear Program Not Actively Developing Weapons

text: Report from a BBC journalist in Israel: Everyone I talk to shows signs of despair and hopelessness, everyone wants to leave this place.
title: Despair and Hopelessness in Israel

text: After the Iranian missile passes the enemy's anti-ballistic missile systems, they are forced to resort to launching the Iron Dome system to prevent the missiles from hitting, which indicates their desperation and helplessness. However, as can be seen, the projectiles hit their designated targets one after another, destroying them. The sound from the cameraman indicates that the targeted area contains important points, which have caused panic among them.
title: Iranian Missiles Overcome Enemy Defenses

text:
The Saderat Bank disruption will be resolved soon.

A cyberattack on the Saderat Bank infrastructure caused disruption in its non-physical services a short while ago.

Due to the bank's support for some fuel stations, there may be disruptions in some gas pumps in the coming hours.

It is expected that the problem will be resolved within a few hours.
title: Saderat Bank Cyberattack Causes Service Disruption

text:
Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi stated that Benjamin Netanyahu is a fraud who has deceived U.S. presidents, leading them into wars for nearly thirty years.

According to all signs, Netanyahu's criminal attack on Iran aims to sabotage the deal between Iran and the U.S., which was on the right path. He is playing the American president and taxpayers as fools.

If President Trump is sincere in diplomacy and interested in ending this war, then the next steps will be consistent. Israel must cease its aggression, and if there is no complete cessation of military aggression against us, our responses will continue. Just one phone call from Washington can silence someone like Netanyahu. This could pave the way for a return to diplomacy.

Conversely, involving the U.S. in this "mother of eternal wars" will destroy any prospects for settlement through negotiations, which will lead to dangerous, unpredictable, and likely incomprehensible consequences for regional security and the global economy.

This was written by Araghchi, sharing a video of Netanyahu's September 2002 congressional hearing, where he called for an invasion of Iraq, stating there was no doubt Saddam Hussein had not abandoned his nuclear program and was obsessed with creating atomic bombs.
title: Iranian Official Criticizes Netanyahu and U.S. Policy

â—ï¸The Iranian Foreign Minister Abdol-Abbas Araghchi stated that Benjamin Netanyahu is a fraud who has deceived US presidents, causing them to wage wars for nearly three decades.

All signs suggest that Netanyahu's criminal attack on Iran aims to sabotage the DEAL between Iran and the US, which we were on the right track to achieve. He is playing another American president and taxpayers as fools.

If President Trump is sincere in diplomacy and interested in ending this war, the next steps will be consistent. Israel must cease its aggression, and if the military aggression against us does not stop completely, our responses will continue. One phone call from Washington can silence someone like Netanyahu. That could pave the way for a return to diplomacy.

Conversely, involving the US in this 'mother of all wars' will destroy any prospects for resolution through negotiations, leading to dangerous, unpredictable, and likely incomprehensible consequences for regional security and the global economy.

Araghchi shared a video from hearing in Congress in September 2002 where Netanyahu called for invading Iraq, stating there is no doubt Saddam Hussein did not abandon his nuclear program and was obsessed with creating nuclear bombs.
title: Iranian Foreign Minister criticizes Netanyahu and warns of regional risks

text:
June 16-17, the delegation of the Ministry of Defense of the Republic of Armenia, led by the Secretary General of the Ministry of Defense of the Republic of Armenia, Hamlet Batikyan, participated in the extended technical briefing of the Vienna Agreements concerning military goods control and the updating process of the lists in Vienna.

The Armenian delegation held a separate meeting with the Japanese Ambassador Kaifu Atsushi, the country chairing the Vienna Agreements, and with the head of the Vienna Agreements Secretariat, Ambassador Georgi Molnar. Discussions focused on cooperation within the Vienna Agreements framework and possibilities for expansion.

The delegation also met separately with colleagues from the USA and France. The discussions addressed cooperation issues regarding military goods control.
title: Armenian Defense Delegation Participates in Vienna Agreements Briefing

text:
On June 16-17, the Armenian Ministry of Defense delegation, led by Secretary General Hamlet Batyanyan, participated in an extended technical briefing within the Vasenaar agreements in Vienna. The briefing covered control over military products and the process of updating lists.

The Armenian delegation held a separate meeting with Japan's ambassador and chairperson of the Vasenaar agreements, Kafu Atsushi, and the head of the Vasenaar agreements Secretariat, Ambassador Georgy Molnar. They discussed cooperation within the Vasenaar agreements and possibilities for expansion.

The delegation also met with colleagues from the USA and France, discussing issues related to cooperation in military product control.

text:
Salahi Mehr spoke after the merciless attack by the Zionist regime on IRIB.

Foreign Minister:
Last night, during the savage attack by the Zionist regime on IRIB, an Iranian heroine stood in front of the camera; fearless, steadfast, and patriotic.
She was the voice of Iran; the voice of Zainab who does not allow "Karbala to stay in Karbala."

Our land, the birthplace of proud women and men who consider death smaller than their honor. A land where its children have grown up with the mourning of Imam Hussain (A.S.), and they are undefeatable.
title: Iranian Woman Stands Against Zionist Attack

text:
Iran has announced that it has begun using new weaponry against Israel. Tehran has started deploying new weapons against Israel, according to IRIB, citing the commander of Iran's ground forces, Kayoumars Heidari.

"Massive UAV attacks using new and advanced weaponry have begun, and they will only intensify in the coming hours," he said.

According to the SNN channel, Iran has already attacked a military intelligence logistics center near the Glilot base in the suburbs of Tel Aviv. Earlier, as reported by the state agency Tasnim, the Mossad building in Herzliya was also hit by a rocket attack.
title: Iran deploys new weapons against Israel

text:
Iran hacked Mossad's child exploitation ransom vault days before Israel's war

According to reports, days before Israel's attacks, Iranian hackers conducted a massive cyberattack â€” reportedly stealing three terabytes of top-secret Israeli data, according to a program host on "Voice of the People" on "X." He claims that Israel's strikes against senior commanders and intelligence facilities might have aimed to destroy this digital treasure.

What dirty secrets could have been in it?

Jeffrey Epstein and his child predator ring

It is said that Epstein did not commit suicide but was smuggled out of the United States because he was a valuable asset of Mossad. Is that possible?

In July 2021, Rolling Stone reported that Epstein might have been a "spy."

Yariv Ben Menahem, a former Mossad officer, claimed Epstein worked for Israeli intelligence.

Media and former agents allege Epstein used underage girls as honey traps for politicians â€” possibly to serve Mossad's interests.

Before the Israeli attack, disturbing details about a trafficking ring, including disturbing sexual rituals involving minors, were released.

Despite Trumpâ€™s promise to declassify Epsteinâ€™s documents, the cases remain secret. Do they involve Israel â€” or American politicians?

"Prophecy" by Netanyahu about 9/11

TPV's Shawn references Netanyahu and some Jewish rabbis' prescient knowledge of 9/11, with some even suggesting Mossad's alleged involvement in the "controlled demolitions" of the Twin Towers.

In 2002, Netanyahu told Congress there was "no doubt" Saddam Hussein was building weapons of mass destruction.

It is claimed that the US invasion of Iraq, under the banner of the "War on Terror," weakened regional enemies of Israel. Netanyahu may have orchestrated 9/11 to incite Washington against Arabs.

According to Maariv, in 2008, Netanyahu said that 9/11 was "beneficial" for Israel.

Now, Netanyahu insists Iran is close to developing nuclear weapons and must be bombed. Still sounds familiar?

Again, despite increasing calls for declassification, the 9/11 files remain top secret.
title: Iran Hacks Mossad Before Israeli War

title: Iran Confirms Attack on Mossad Headquarters

text: ğŸ”´ Mehr Agency writes about a new betrayal by Azerbaijan.
title: New Allegation of Azerbaijan's Betrayal

text:
Azerbaijani state media reports that Azerbaijan has sent a message to Israel's leadership via various channels, urging not to strike populated areas in Iran where Azerbaijanis live, and to refrain from attacking civilian infrastructure and the civilian population.

 It sounds like an accusation against Israel for targeting civilian infrastructure and civilians, while simultaneously calling for continuing such actions in other Iranian settlements.

 On one hand, it is unclear which specific Iranian settlements lack Iranian Azerbaijanis and which cities Azerbaijan is urging to bomb.

 On the other hand, it is unclear why Azerbaijan "transmitted the message through various channels" if Ilham Aliyev could simply call the Israeli Prime Minister?

 But then a third party comes into play, and numerous reports from Iranian sources are recalled, stating that the main attacks were on Tehriz, a predominantly Azerbaijani-inhabited city, with many of these attacks carried out using drones that penetrated Iran from Azerbaijan.

 It becomes obvious that no actual message was sent, and the phrase "through various channels" was invented specifically to avoid specifics and, consequently, denial from Israel itself.
title: Azerbaijan and Israel Communication Claims

text:
Saraya Al-Quds released footage of a Zionist tank being detonated with a powerful explosive during its incursion west of Izbat Beit Hanoun in northern Gaza.

Notes:
1:04 - The targeted vehicle
1:27 - Complete destruction of the vehicle and the incineration of those inside.
1:29 - "Here we are today, we have not retreated from our positions, and we have not abandoned them. They came at us with robots and blew up all the areas, yet we are still present. Some of us were martyred, and others wounded, but never, never will we leave our positions. Never, never will we leave our positions.

We are here, many in number, and we cleared the obstacles after the vehicle explosion and the robot detonations. We blew up their vehicles and clashed with their soldiers. We are advancingâ€”we will not retreat from the fight, for this is a fight of belief, a fight in the path of God.

Peace and the mercy of God be upon you"
title: Palestinian Fighters Resisting Israeli Incursion

ğŸš¨ Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza:
â€”
Daily statistical report on the number of martyrs and wounded as a result of the â€œisraeliâ€ aggression on the Gaza Strip.

61 martyrs (6 recovered) and 397 injuries arrived at Gaza Strip hospitals over the past 24 hours.

A number of victims remain under the rubble and on the roads, unable to be reached by ambulance and civil defense crews.

The martyrdom toll from the â€œisraeliâ€ aggression has risen to 55,493 martyrs and 129,320 injuries since October 7, 2023.

The martyrdom toll and injuries since March 18, 2025 has reached 5,194 martyrs and 17,279 injuries.

The total number of martyrs of aid who arrived at hospitals in the last 24 hours is 59, and more than 200 injuries, as the total number of aid martyrs who arrived at hospitals from the areas designated for distributing aid reached 397 martyrs and more than 3,031 injuries.

Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza.

text:
Breaking / Audio recording of Mossad officer in a meeting with Zionist media: We must bring the Iranian people to the streets.

Mordechai Kidar, Mossad officer (active in Iran desk):
They ask why I insist on bringing the Iranian people into the streets? And criticize why I focus not on military war?
The answer is clear, ask yourselves: can we defeat Iran alone? I donâ€™t want to alarm you, but this is impossible.
Well then, do we wait for America to help us? America couldnâ€™t continue the war with Yemen for more than a month, and thatâ€™s a false expectation.
So if it continues like this, Iran will attack our infrastructure with terrorist attacks every day, and we will face a great defeat.
The only thing that can save us from failure and prevent major disasters is to organize the Iranian people against the terrorist regime and have them act against this government.
We must be realistic; Iran is not Gaza, not Hezbollah. Iran is a government with 50 years of history, it is vast and has strong infrastructure. My insistence is so that a catastrophe does not occur in our land. This is also the emphasis of Prime Minister Bibi.
title: Mossad Officer Calls for Iranian People's Protest

text:
French President Emmanuel Macron believes that the desire to change the regime in Iran by force from outside is a strategic mistake.

Commenting on the confrontation between Israel and Iran, the French president called on the sides to refrain from strikes on civilian objects.

"It is absolutely necessary for all attacks on energy infrastructure, cultural and administrative objects, and especially on the civilian population, to cease," Macron said.
title: Macron Criticizes External Regime Change in Iran

The Israeli rear command intends to abandon the practice of sending advance notifications about possible missile strikes, which are currently sent 15â€“30 minutes before the expected launch from Iran.

According to Channel 12 of Israeli television, emergency alerts sent a few minutes before the strike will continue to be transmitted to mobile devices.

Daily Report of the General Directorate of Civil Defense in the Gaza Strip

Between the morning of Monday, 16 June 2025, and the morning of Tuesday, Civil Defense crews in the governorates of the Gaza Strip carried out 37 missions amid the ongoing "Israeli" aggression. These included 6 rescue operations, 22 medical evacuations, and 6 firefighting missions.

North Gaza Governorate:
â€¢ Fire extinguished in an apartment belonging to the Abu Ouda family near Al-Qouqa roundabout in northern Gaza; no injuries reported.
â€¢ Body of a martyr retrieved after being killed by "Israeli" fire in the Ard Halawa area of Jabalia.

Central Governorate:
â€¢ Fire extinguished on an electric pole at the entrance of Nusseirat.
â€¢ Fire extinguished at a house belonging to the Abu Al-Aour family in Deir Al-Balah.
â€¢ Body of a martyr retrieved from a house belonging to the Ghurab family in Al-Bureij camp.
â€¢ Body parts of martyrs retrieved from a shack targeted by the occupation near Abu Jaber roundabout in the Al-Zawaida area.

Khan Younis Governorate:
â€¢ Dealt with 6 injuries following an "Israeli" strike in the Japanese neighborhood; all transferred to Nasser Hospital.
â€¢ Treated one injury after a drone strike (quadcopter) targeting civilians in the Asdaa area.
â€¢ Treated one injury from an "Israeli" strike in the Regional area; transferred to the British Hospital.
â€¢ Retrieved 2 bodies and one injured person following a strike on a displaced personsâ€™ tent near Al-Ribat College.
â€¢ Retrieved one martyr after an "Israeli" strike in the Emirati neighborhood.
â€¢ Retrieved one martyr shot by "Israeli" forces on Al-Bahr Street; body transferred to Nasser Hospital.

text:
Water supply in the Kuds Square area in Tehran, disrupted due to an Israeli strike on civilian infrastructure, will be fully restored today.

Local utility services have reported that all work has been completed, and systems have been modernized â€” old pipes replaced with new stainless steel ones using modern technologies.

It is noted that the quality of the water supply network now exceeds the level before the shelling.
title: Water Supply Restored in Tehran

text:
Successful neutralization of an unidentified drone through guard operations in Malayer.

This drone, which intended to conduct sabotage activities and create insecurity in the area, was closely monitored and intercepted by the defense systems deployed in Malayer before reaching its target.

Additionally, over the past 24 hours, two other drones and micro-drones were identified and destroyed by the Unknown Soldiers of Imam Zaman before reaching their targets.

Security forces utilize advanced equipment and 24-hour surveillance to monitor any suspicious movements and respond promptly.
title: Drone Interception in Malayer

text:
Ongoing Israeli aggression on Tulkarem and escalation in demolitions and raids. The Israeli occupation forces continue their escalating aggression on the city of Tulkarem and its camp for the 142nd consecutive day, and on Nour Shams camp for the 129th day, through the ongoing demolition of homes.

This morning, occupation bulldozers resumed the demolition of more residential buildings in Tulkarem camp for the 12th consecutive day, targeting the neighborhoods of Al-Balawneh, Al-Okasha, Al-Nadi, and Al-Sawalmeh, and their surroundings, leveling them to the ground.

The occupation is carrying out a planned scheme to demolish 106 buildings in both Tulkarem and Nour Shams camps, including 58 buildings in Tulkarem camp alone, comprising over 250 housing units and dozens of commercial facilities, and 48 buildings in Nour Shams, under the pretext of opening roads and altering the campsâ€™ geographic layout.

A tight siege is being imposed by the occupation forces on both camps and their surroundings, with infantry units and military vehicles deployed throughout the alleyways, neighborhoods, and entrances. Residents are being prevented from reaching their homes to check on them or retrieve belongings, with live fire opened on anyone attempting to approach.

Ziyad Shukri Al-Jallad, 55, from Tulkarem city and a person with disabilities, was shot in the leg by occupation forces while in one of the cityâ€™s neighborhoods.

Tulkarem is witnessing intensified military activity by occupation vehicles around the clock, particularly in the central market, Martyr Thabet Thabet Government Hospital Street, Nablus Street, and the northern neighborhood, where civilians and vehicles are deliberately obstructed, sirens are blared provocatively, and vehicles are driven against traffic, endangering lives.

The occupation is also tightening restrictions at the military checkpoints surrounding Tulkarem, erecting sudden barriers near Jabara Bridge gate (south) and â€˜Anabta checkpoint (east), where vehicles are stopped, searched, and passengers subjected to questioning and deliberate movement delays, often being denied passage altogether.

Nablus Street remains militarized, with continued occupation of several residential buildings and parts of the northern neighborhood facing Tulkarem camp, where residents were forcibly displaced. Some of these buildings have been under occupation control for over four months, accompanied by the deployment of heavy machinery and bulldozers in the area.

The ongoing aggression has resulted in the martyrdom of 13 civilians, including a child and two women, one of whom was eight months pregnant, in addition to dozens of injuries and arrests. There has also been widespread destruction of infrastructure, homes, shops, and vehicles.

The assault on Tulkarem has displaced over 5,000 families from the two camps, more than 25,000 civilians, with at least 400 homes completely destroyed and 2,573 homes partially damaged, amid the continued closure of camp entrances with barriers, rendering them nearly lifeless zones.
title: Israeli Aggression and demolitions in Tulkarem

text:
We are closely monitoring the events in the region.

During a press conference in Yerevan, Iranian Ambassador to Armenia Mehdi Sobhani said in response to a question about whether Azerbaijan could exploit the Iran-Israel conflict and attack Syunik.

"We are in contact with regional countries, expressing our concern. We have very clear red lines and have proven that we will not cross them. We live in a world of probabilities, some of which can cause concern. However, we deal with facts, and we remain vigilant. I believe the Armenian government is also watching the developments. We have very close relations with the Armenian government and conduct regular consultations. The behavior of countries during this period will affect our future relations with them. Friends and enemies are known in difficult times," Mehdi Sobhani noted.
title: Iranian Ambassador on regional tensions and Armenia

text:
ISNA received a warning; Mahtareh Goonayei was detained / Sadegh Al-Hosseini received another warning.

According to the actions of the Special Command Post of Tehran Prosecutor's Office in monitoring cyberspace and identifying those disturbing the psychological security of people during the Zionist aggression, some media outlets and online activists who did not comply with legal regulations in their content received warnings, some faced legal cases, and a number were detained.

Among the media, ISNA News Agency, Iran Watchdog website, and Asr Iran website, Telegram channels Salam and Mostafa MehrAyan, Mahtareh Goonayei, Sadegh Al-Hosseini, Ali Sharif Zarchi, Asal Esmailzadeh, Hasan Asadi Lari, Aytieh Rad, Ali Taremi, Atefeh Chahar Mahalayan, Hadi Tabaqgar, and Hadi Kasayi Zadeh were among the cyber activists; some received warnings, some had legal cases filed against them, and others were detained by judicial orders.

Since the apparent Zionist invasion of our countryâ€™s soil, in line with the emphasis of the head of the judiciary and the prosecutor general's statement on confronting those who threaten the psychological security of society, a special task force has been formed at Tehran Prosecutor's Office to monitor cyberspace and media and ensure societal security.

This task force, through diligent cyberspace monitoring, media, and official news agencies, catalogs various issues and cases based on different topics and refers them to specialized prosecutorâ€™s offices.
title: Iran monitors cyberspace amid Zionist conflict

text:
Deputy from Pashinyan's party promised to study the question of what funds are used for the campaign "Education â€“ It's Fashionable".

A deputy from Armenia's ruling "Civil Contract" party commented on the funding of the "Education â€“ It's Fashionable" campaign, which involves Turkish expatriate and his partner Anna Akopyan. In a conversation with journalists on June 17, Sarkis Handanyan, answering why authorities keep expenses related to the "Education â€“ It's Fashionable" movement secret, suggested that these expenses are only related to security measures, for example, those associated with the State Security Service.

"I can't say more because I don't have the topic. Honestly, I don't know what funds are being used. I advise you to continue monitoring the inquiry and to continue studying, and I will also continue to look into it," Handanyan noted.
title: Armenian Deputy Discusses Education Campaign Funding

text:
ğŸš¨ Palestinian Journalists Protection Center:
â€”
Beneath the Rubble: Journalist Mohammad Atta Allah and the Dream Left Unfulfilled

Amid the widespread devastation of Al-Shati Refugee Camp, west of Gaza City, Mohammad Atta Allah was catching his breath between shots, his camera capturing what words could never fully convey: skies filled with smoke, the screams of children, and lost faces searching for shelter under a storm of bombardment. He carried no weapon but his lens, and his only hope was simple: â€œLet the message be heard.â€

But his final message was not a news report, it was a heartbreaking image of his body beneath the rubble, alongside 17 members of his family, including his children. On the morning of January 29, 2024, an "Israeli" airstrike targeted the home where Atta Allah and his family had taken shelter in Al-Shati Camp. He was martyred instantly. The only survivor was his wife, Israa, who was in her final month of pregnancy. She was pulled from the debris alive, left as the sole witness to the massacre, and later gave birth to their daughter, Alaa, a name Mohammad had chosen before the bombing stole him away.

A Journalist to the Very End

Atta Allah, 33, worked as an editor for the local newspaper Al-Risala and as a correspondent for Lebanonâ€™s Raseef22 platform.

Despite internet outages and mounting dangers, he continued his field reporting from northern Gaza, documenting the suffering of civilians under fire. Just days before he was martyred, he told his wife: â€œThis is the message we promised our people to deliver it,â€ a testament to his unwavering commitment as a journalist and as a human being.

His surviving wife, Israa, shared her heartbreak with the Palestinian Journalists Protection Center (PJPC):
â€œThey pulled me out from under the rubble, but all my memories died with him. He feared the pain that might reach us. He shared everything with meâ€”even the housework. He wasnâ€™t just my husbandâ€”he was my support, my entire world.â€

Mohammad was more than a reporter. He was a community activist and a volunteer in Quran memorization centers. He took part in initiatives to bring smiles to childrenâ€™s faces in mosques and shelters. He dreamed of rebuilding his house in northern Gaza, which had already been destroyed once before by "Israeli" strikes, and longed for the moment he would reunite with his parents, who remained trapped in the south. But the missiles of war shattered that dream.

Systematic Targeting of Journalists

According to the Palestinian Journalists Protection Center (PJPC) and international organizations, Atta Allahâ€™s killing is part of a systematic pattern of targeting media workers. Official Palestinian statistics report that over 220 Palestinian journalists have been killed since the war began in October 2023, making it the deadliest conflict for journalists in modern history.

â€œThe occupation deliberately kills journalists,â€ Israa says, â€œbecause it doesnâ€™t want its crimes to be exposed to the world.â€

Though he was martyred, Atta Allah left behind a legacy of images, testimonies, and words that continue to tell Gazaâ€™s story, its relentless fight to survive. And while baby Alaa was born an orphan, her name now carries the story of a father who held his pen and camera until his last breath, a living witness to one of the most brutal chapters of war against civilians and journalists in modern times.

There is some discussion about monopolies, masochism, and low voltage issues in the electricity network in Armenia, which could escalate to dangerous levels on the streets.

Armenia has historically been known for monopolies, with the market quota-controlled by authorities, dictating import, production, and export limits, along with associated fees. In 2018, restrictions were lifted to allow free import and sales, requiring only taxes.

However, natural monopolies still exist, like ZAO "Electrical Networks of Armenia" (ESA), a private company responsible for electricity supply, created amid public dissatisfaction with prices and service quality, which led to protests and the departure of officials.

Currently, ESA displays a negligent attitude toward consumers. Frequent outages, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ€ĞºĞ° ÑÑ‡ĞµÑ‚Ñ‡Ğ¸ĞºĞ¾Ğ², surges damaging appliances, lack of clear communication about outages, difficulty reaching customer service, extra costs for equipment, and low voltage issuesâ€”especially in rural areasâ€”are widespread problems.

Many citizens are affected, and the repeated failure to address these issues raises questions about what actions are needed.

The proposed solution is the nationalization of ESA, emphasizing its strategic importance and criticizing its privatization.

According to information from @bagramyan26, the government had considered nationalization but waited, trusting promises from ESA's owner. The ongoing poor service increases risks of dangerous situations, including incidents in elevators and electrical infrastructure.

The message calls for urgent action: "We demand the nationalization of Electric Networks of Armenia."
title: Call for Nationalization of Electric Networks of Armenia

text: Nelly Gulyan, the press secretary of the Office of the Main Commissioner for Diaspora Affairs of Armenia, provided details about the situation in Armenian communities in Israel and Iran. According to her, there is currently no information about injured or deceased members of these communities. At this time, no statements have been made by representatives of Armenian communities in Iran and Israel regarding relocation.
title: Armenian Communities in Israel and Iran Stable

text:
Russia will invest $270 million in the modernization of Armenia's gas system. This includes expanding the Abovyan gas storage station, reconstructing pipelines, and connecting new consumers.

The work is scheduled to be completed by 2028.

text:
The Lemkin Institute condemns US President Donald Trump's social media post calling on Iranian citizens to "immediately evacuate Tehran".

"Posting terrorist threats on social media is behavior unworthy of a head of state," the institute's statement says.
title: Lemkin Institute Condemns Trump's Iran Evacuation Call

text:
The Iranian embassy has no information about Armenians killed in Iran, nor about refugees from Iran to Armenia.

This was stated by Iran's ambassador to Armenia, Mehdi Sobhani, at a press conference in Yerevan.

It is known that a large number of Iranian citizens who were in Turkey and Russia have returned to their homeland via Armenia.

text:
Deputies from the 'Civil Contract' unleashed threats against Catholicos of All Armenians and businessman Samvel Karapetyan

Today, the speeches of deputies from the parliamentary faction of the ruling party 'Civil Contract' in the National Assembly focused solely on the Armenian Apostolic Church, Catholicos of All Armenians Garegin II, and individuals who defended them.

Most often, the name of the owner of 'Electric Networks of Armenia' Samvel Karapetyan was mentioned, who previously expressed support for AA. In response to this 'demarche,' the head of the ruling party's parliamentary faction, Aik Konjoryan, proposed nationalizing the company on June 17.
title: Armenian Deputies Threaten Religious Figures and Businessman

text: According to the Iranian ambassador in Armenia, they are now using Armenian buses to transport citizens from Armenia to Iran due to a reduction in ground transportation. Recently, about 30 Iranian cultural figures were transported to Iran on Armenian buses from Armenia. Previously, there were around 20 flights weekly between Iran and Armenia, but now trips must be made via the land border. Approximately 600 freight vehicles cross daily between Iran and Armenia.
title: Iranian Embassy Reports Use of Armenian Buses for Citizen Transport

Your services and sacrifices in performing assigned missions are commendable. The people of Iran acknowledge your professional and committed performance in defending national security.

We wish health and success to all personnel of these bases. We hope you can continue your service with strength and determination.

With respect, the Iranian nation

Pashinyan's attacks on the Church distract the public from his visit to Turkey.

Bishop Ovnian Akopyan commented on Pashinyan's posts today. He particularly noted: "It's easier to tame a wild animal than to reason with an ignorant person."

The country's main troublemaker, who considers himself a child of the Armenian Church, has once again discredited the Armenian Apostolic Church, its parishioners, and faithful followers. He once again tries to divert people's attention from important political events happening in the world, especially from his planned visit to Turkey, during which it's unclear what dark deed the "Prince of Darkness" will commit.

text:
Hybrid warfare against Armenia

Bots from the 'Matryoshka' network started a campaign against Pashinyan. He was accused of concealing the Armenian genocide and of taking strong tranquilizers.

The pro-Kremlin 'Matryoshka' bots targeted Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. He is criticized for 'the highest level of corruption in the Middle East' and for hiding the Armenian genocide, while some bots claim that he allegedly takes 'strong tranquilizers.'

According to The Insider project 'Bot Blocker,' 'Matryoshka' first drew attention to the Armenian prime minister. One possible reason for the information attack could be Pashinyan's upcoming visit to Ankara on June 20. Some of the videos are fake Turkish media content.

Most of the videos studied by The Insider are about the alleged concealment of the Armenian genocide of 1915-1923 by the current government. Other videos are disguised as content from social media of major foreign media outlets.

A video attributed to Turkish media Yeni Åafak claims that Pashinyan takes 'strong tranquilizers.' It is said that this information was reported by American neurobiologist Nancy Andreasen. However, no such information exists in open sources.

Read in Russia without VPN.

Fake video spread by the Kremlin disinformation network 'Matryoshka.' Source: 'Bot Blocker.'

Author: The Insider
title: Disinformation Campaign Against Armenia

text:
Primacy Echmiadzin condemns actions against Samvel Karapetyan

Strongly condemn the persecution on obvious political motives. This is stated in a statement released by the Holy Echmiadzin in connection with actions taken against the owner of the "Tashir Group" company, philanthropist Samvel Karapetyan.

The statement says, in particular:

"It has just become known that immediately after expressing support for the Armenian Church, law enforcement agencies attempted to detain national benefactor Samvel Karapetyan, and a search is currently being conducted at his house.

We strongly condemn the persecution on obvious political motives. We call on the Armenian authorities to immediately stop illegal actions."
title: Echmiadzin condemns actions against Samvel Karapetyan

text:
ğŸš¨ The US military withdrew from two bases (Al-Wazir and Baydar) in northeastern Syria. Cameras were removed from the bases, which housed both Kurdish SDF and American forces.

This brings the number of evacuated military bases in Syria to 4 since the start of the year.

text:
The US is preparing for a scenario in which President Donald Trump may order the US Air Force to refuel Israeli fighters in the air during their strikes on Iran. Two sources familiar with the situation told CNN.

According to them, more than 30 American refueling aircraft have been deployed to the region in recent days for this purpose.

Such support is considered one of the least active ways for the US to engage in the conflict, the sources noted. In a broader context, the deployment of refueling aircraft aims to provide Trump and the US Central Command (CENTCOM) with options for action in case of further escalation and potential deepening of American involvement," one of the sources said.
title: US Prepares for Possible Air Support in Iran Conflict

text:
Currently, a person is sitting in their cozy and wealthy home, possibly reading this post... But in the news feed of Russian state media, a "sensation" is being spun that has overshadowed not only the Iran-Israel war but also its own. The regular agitators are beginning their usual unrest and are already monitoring, analyzing, etc.

Samvel Karapetyan is Armenian, located in Armenia, and Armenia is, by the way, a legal state. Therefore, we advise the Moscow alarmists to worry about others "theirs" who are held in other countries and subjected to court proceedings.

And the fact that in Moscow they are used to confusing law with telephone lawâ€”well, that's a dangerous habit...

text:
The Armenian authorities face a simple question: was the decision to "review" property rights to the electric grids owned by Samvel Karapetyan made before or after his recent statements?

Just so the business community understands: if you stay silent â€” you have a business; if you speak out â€” it's gone.

In Russia, for example, this model has long been worked out â€” everyone understands everything. The question is: do we correctly understand that Armenia has decided to adopt exactly this part of "democracy" from Russia? The other elements are from Europe, but this â€” exclusively along an eastern vector?

And also: do we interpret the current line correctly â€” that any statement louder than plumbing noise, which does not coincide with the official position, is automatically considered a coup, a conspiracy, a fifth column, and part of hybrid warfare? Not against Nikol and his entourage, but supposedly against the Armenian state itself?

No, don't worry â€” these are, of course, rhetorical questions.

text:
The Armenian Apostolic Church commented on the situation with Samvel Karapetyan.

"He simply said that he supports the Church and, if necessary, will fight for the Church," the Armenian Apostolic Church explained to RT why the country's authorities are persecuting Samvel Karapetyan: "Since the authorities are speaking very badly about the Church now, he said: 'I will defend the Church.' This statement, that I, as a true Christian and Armenian, will defend and stand for the support of the Church, was made there, and our government couldn't digest it."

Samvel lives in Russia but was born in Armenia and has been connected to the homeland all his life. He is also a major philanthropist, a national benefactor.

text:
Regime change in Iran will mean chaos, said French President Emmanuel Macron, according to Le Monde.

He assured that criticism of Trump does not concern him.

Macron stated that the United States is "necessary" to bring everyone back to the negotiation table in the Iran-Israel conflict.
title: Macron Warns of Chaos with Iran Regime Change
